title: Bridging visa C (BVC)
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Bridging visa C (Subclass 030), a temporary visa that allows applicants to remain lawfully in Australia while their substantive visa application or related review processes are underway. It outlines eligibility, work rights, duration, obligations, costs, and circumstances that may affect visa validity.

structured_data.description: This visa allows applicants to stay lawfully in Australia after their current substantive visa ends and while a new substantive visa application or judicial review is being processed. It does not allow travel outside Australia.

allowed_until: Substantive visa application is finally determined
Judicial review proceedings are completed (if granted in association with review)

conditions_for_separate_bvc_application: Seeking further BVC without work restrictions

comes_into_effect_when: Another more beneficial bridging visa ceases
visa_holders_must: Comply with conditions of the substantive visa until it ceases
Comply with BVC conditions once the substantive visa ceases
visa_effect.travel_restrictions: Visa does not allow return travel to Australia

judicial_review_information.applies_to: Applicants seeking judicial review after a merits review tribunal upholds refusal

work_rights.initial_bvc_work_rights: Initial BVC generally does not allow work unless the applied substantive visa is listed.

judicial_review_work_rules.protection_visa_applicants: Can only be granted new BVC with work rights if previous BVC allowed work
judicial_review_work_rules.non_protection_visa_applicants: Will be granted BVC without work rights even if previous BVC allowed work

immediate_end_when: Grant of another bridging visa for same substantive application
Cancellation of BVC or associated substantive visa
general_end_conditions: Substantive visa application refused or invalid
Withdrawal of substantive visa application or review application
Merits review tribunal declares no jurisdiction

ceases_35_days_after: Refusal decision by Department or AAT
Determination that substantive visa application or AAT review is invalid
Withdrawal of substantive visa application or AAT review application

ceases_28_days_after_any_of: Merits review tribunal states it has no jurisdiction
Withdrawal of merits or judicial review application

stay_longer.instruction: Must apply for a new visa

include_family.applied_together: If family applied together for substantive visa, they may have applied together for BVC
include_family.apply_separately: Can include family members only if included in substantive visa application

apply_from.location_requirement: Applicant and included family must be in Australia at application and grant

obligations: Comply with BVC conditions once in effect
structured_data.travel: If you leave Australia while the BVC is in effect, you cannot return on it.
structured_data.help_with_visa: Applicants seeking help with their visa should review information on who can assist with visa applications.
